Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and light, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing signs of not growing well or wilting.
The student can identify and label patterns, such as how plants look different with and without water or light.
The student can illustrate the concept that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
